conclusion: To solve for the normal force N between the latch D and the lock groove E during the self-locking state, we need to consider the forces acting on the system.
Spring Force (kx) acts horizontally to the right.
Normal Force (N) acts perpendicular to the surface, i.e., along the 30° angle.
Friction Forces (f1 and f2) are dynamic friction forces opposing the motion.
The normal force N can be resolved into horizontal (N sin θ) and vertical (N cos θ) components.
Horizontal friction f1 = μ N cos θ.
Vertical friction f2 = μ N sin θ.
Horizontal force equilibrium: N sin θ - μ N cos θ = kx.
Vertical force equilibrium: N cos θ + μ N sin θ = 0.
From vertical equilibrium: N cos θ = -μ N sin θ, leading to μ = -cot θ.
Substitute μ = -1/√3 into horizontal equilibrium: N (1/2) + (1/√3) N (√3/2) = kx.
Simplifying gives N/2 + N/2 = kx, leading to N = kx.
The magnitude of the normal force N between the latch D and the lock groove E is kx.
